original: Arnander, Per, praktiserande läkare, Linköping, f. S/7/06 i Linköp. av v. härihövd. Per A. o. Ellen Löfquist. G. 37 m. Gunborg Uhlebäck. Barn: Carl Johan f. 38, Claes 39, Ann-Charlotte 43. — Stud :ex. i Linköp. 26, med. kand. i Upps. 30, med. lic. i Sthlm 36. Assist :läk. v. Linköp. las. med. avd. 36, e. läk. samt tf. andre und :läk, där 36-38, andre und :läk. där 38, förste und :’läk. 40, v. epidisjukh. 43, und:läk. v. barnsjukh. i Linköp. 44, skolläk. v. fo’lksk :sem. 45, egen prakt, i Linköp. sed. 46, spec. inv. sjukd., barnaålderns sjukd.
translated: Arnander, Per, practicing physician, Linkoping, b. 7/6/06 in Linkoping. His parents were lieutenant colonel Per A. and Ellen Lofquist. Married to Gunborg Uhleback in 1937 and had three children: Carl Johan b. 1938, Claes b. 1939, Ann-Charlotte b. 1943. He passed his studentexamen (secondary school leaving exam) in Linkoping in 1926, received his Bachelor of Medicine degree in Uppsala in 1930, and his Medical Licentiate in Stockholm in 1936. He worked as a medical assistant at the medical ward at Linkoping Hospital in 1936 and was a resident physician and acting assistant physician there from 1936-1938. He was promoted to assistant physician in 1938, first assistant physician in 1940, and was a physician in the epidemics hospital in 1943. From 1944, he was a resident physician for infant diseases and was a school physician for the People's Seminary from 1945. In 1946, he started his own practice in Linkoping and specialized in pediatric diseases.
